greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Dirichlet inverse of A076479.
comment: Apart from signs, this sequence is identical to A162512.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: Multiplicative with a(p^e) = 2^(e-1) for any prime p and any positive exponent e.
a(n) = n/2 when n is a power of 2 (A000079).
a(n) = 1 when n is a squarefree number (A005117).
a(1) = 1; a(n) = -Sum_{d|n, d < n} (-1)^omega(n/d) * a(d). - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Mar 10 2021
mathematica: a[n_] := 2^(PrimeOmega[n] - PrimeNu[n]); Array[a, 100] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Apr 24 2017, after _R. J. Mathar_ *)
program: return 1 if n==1 else reduce(mul, [2**(f[i] - 1) for i in f]) # _Indranil Ghosh_, May 20 2017
results.author: _Gerard P. Michon_, Jul 05 2009
